title: How to Make Fruitcake with Dried Fruits

steps.headline: Add the fruits to a non-reactive mixing bowl along with the rum or brandy.
steps.description: You could also use apple juice instead of the liquor, if you like.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl and chill the mixture overnight in the refrigerator.
Add the butter to a mixing bowl and cream well.
Add the sugar, spices and baking powder.
Add the eggs one-at-a-time and beat after each addition of the eggs.
Add the flour and cocoa to a mixing bowl and whisk to combine.
Add half the flour mixture along with syrup to the batter ingredients.
Add the remaining flour and the juice or water to the batter.
Fold in the fruits and nuts to the batter along with any remaining liquid.
Preheat oven to 300 °F (149 °C).
Grease the bottoms and sides of two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.
Spoon the batter into the prepared pans filling the pans about 3/4 full.
Bake cakes for two hours and 15 minutes.
Remove cakes from the oven and brush with rum or brandy.
Allow the cakes to cool and then brush them with rum or brandy or try the corn syrup glaze included with this recipe.
Add the corn syrup and water to a saucepan.
Heat the mixture until it just reaches a rolling boil.
Allow the glaze to cool.
Brush the fruitcakes with glaze.
Finished.

text: Making the Cake Add the fruits to a non-reactive mixing bowl along with the rum or brandy. You could also use apple juice instead of the liquor, if you like. Cover the bowl and chill the mixture overnight in the refrigerator.  Add the butter to a mixing bowl and cream well.  Add the sugar, spices and baking powder. Mix into the butter mixture. Add the eggs one-at-a-time and beat after each addition of the eggs.  Add the flour and cocoa to a mixing bowl and whisk to combine.  Add half the flour mixture along with syrup to the batter ingredients.  Add the remaining flour and the juice or water to the batter. Mix well. Fold in the fruits and nuts to the batter along with any remaining liquid.  Preheat oven to 300 °F (149 °C).  Grease the bottoms and sides of two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.  Spoon the batter into the prepared pans filling the pans about 3/4 full.  Bake cakes for two hours and 15 minutes.  Remove cakes from the oven and brush with rum or brandy.  Allow the cakes to cool and then brush them with rum or brandy or try the corn syrup glaze included with this recipe.  Making the Glaze Add the corn syrup and water to a saucepan.  Heat the mixture until it just reaches a rolling boil.  Allow the glaze to cool.  Brush the fruitcakes with glaze.  Finished.
